alert.note: Alert for Bolivar Peninsula; Brazoria Islands; Galveston Island; Matagorda Islands (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued December 19 at 8:24AM CST until December 19 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Strong rip currents will occur along Gulf-facing beaches. In addition, strong easterly winds will result in elevated water levels along the coast. Wave run up may approach the Highway 87 / 124 corridor during high tide this afternoon. * WHERE...Matagorda Islands, Brazoria Islands, Galveston Island, and Bolivar Peninsula * WHEN..Until 6 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: A Beach Hazards Statement is issued when threats such as rip currents...longshore currents...sneaker waves and other hazards create life-threatening conditions in the surf zone. Caution should be used when in or near the water.

area.areaDesc: Bolivar Peninsula; Brazoria Islands; Galveston Island; Matagorda Islands
